exercises.title: Enough As An Adjective And Adverb

questions.question: The hall is …………………………. to seat all guests.
questions.description: When enough is an adverb it goes after the adjective modified by it.

questions.question: The bananas are …………………………. to be eaten.
questions.description: When enough is an adverb it goes after the adjective modified by it.

questions.question: We haven’t got …………………………. to buy a car.
questions.description: When enough is an adjective, it goes before the noun modified by it.

questions.question: You are …………………………. to marry.
questions.description: When enough is an adverb it goes after the adjective modified by it.

questions.question: Are there …………………………….?

questions.description: When enough is an adjective it goes before the noun modified by it.
